tuv.seg: Taxation of married people and civil partners
Gearradh cánach ar dhaoine pósta in Éirinn
If you get married, both you and your spouse continue to be treated as single people for tax purposes in that year
Sa bhliain ina bpósann tú, caitear leat agus le do pháirtí fós mar dhaoine singile ó thaobh cánach de
If, however, the tax you pay as two single people is greater than the tax that would be payable if you were taxed as a married couple, you can claim the difference

Má bhíonn an méid cánach a íocann sibh mar bheirt shingil níos mó ná an méid cánach a bheadh iníoctha dá ngearrfaí cáin oraibh mar lánúin phósta áfach, beidh sibh in ann éileamh a dhéanamh ar an difríocht idir an dá shuim
(In other words, you can claim a tax refund)
(I bhfocail eile, beidh sibh in ann éileamh a dhéanamh ar aisíocaíocht chánach)
Refunds are only due from the date of marriage and will be calculated after the following 31 December
Ní bhíonn aisíocaíochtaí dlite ach ó dháta an phósta, agus ríomhfar iad tar éis an 31 Nollaig ina dhiaidh
So, for example, if you get married in 2017, any tax refund due to you will be calculated after 31 December 2017
Mar shampla, má phós tú i Mí Eanáir 2014, ríomhfar aisíocaíocht chánach ar bith a d'fhéadfadh a bheith iníoctha, tar éis an 31 Nollaig 2014

Refunds are normally only due where a couple are taxed at different rates and one spouse could benefit from the unused standard rate cut-off point or for some of the unused tax credits of the other spouse

De ghnáth ní bhíonn aisíocaíochtaí dlite ach sa chás ina ngearrtar cáin ar lánúin ar rátaí difriúla, agus go bhféadfadh páirtí amháin leas a bhaint as scoithphointe an ráta chaighdeánaigh nár úsáideadh, nó as cuid de chreidmheasanna cánach nár úsáideadh de chuid an chéile eile
When you get married therefore, it is important to advise the tax office of the date of your marriage
Nuair a phósann tú, mar sin, tá sé tábhachtach an oifig chánach a chur ar an eolas faoi dháta an phósta
You will also need to quote your own and your spouse's Personal Public Service Number (PPS number)
Beidh ort d'Uimhir Phearsanta Seirbhíse Poiblí agus uimhir do pháirtí a chur in iúl chomh maith
For the years following your marriage, there are three options for taxation
I gcomhair na mblianta i ndiaidh do phósta, tá trí rogha ar fáil ó taobh cánachais ar dhaoine pósta
All of the options and the outcomes of choosing them are outlined below
Déantar cur síos thíos ar na roghanna go léir agus na torthaí a éiríonn as iad a roghnú
• Assessment as a single person (i.e. you are both still taxed as single people)
• Measúnú mar dhuine singil (is é sin, gearrtar cáin oraibh beirt mar dhaoine singile)
Assessment as a single person
Measúnú mar dhuine singil
Under assessment as a single person, each spouse/civil partner is treated as a single person for tax reasons
Le measúnú mar dhuine singil, caitear le gach páirtí mar dhuine singil ó thaobh cánach de
• Both spouses/civil partners are taxed on their own income
• Gearrtar cáin ar an mbeirt pháirtithe ar a n-ioncam féin
• Both spouses/civil partners get tax credits and the same standard rate cut-off point due to a single person
• Faigheann an bheirt pháirtithe creidmheasanna cánach agus scoithphointe an ráta chaighdeánaigh dlite ag duine singil
• Both spouses/civil partners pay their own tax
• Íocann an bheirt pháirtithe a gcáin féin
• Both spouses/civil partners complete their own return of income form and claim their own tax credits
• Líonann an bheirt pháirtithe a dtuairisceáin ioncaim féin agus déanann siad éileamh ar a gcreidmheasanna cánach féin
One spouse/civil partner cannot claim relief for payments made by the other
Ní fhéadfaidh páirtí amháin faoiseamh a éileamh ar íocaíochtaí a rinne an duine eile
There is no right to transfer tax credits or standard rate cut-off point to each other
Níl aon cheart acu creidmheasanna cánach nó scoithphointe an ráta chaighdeánaigh a aistriú chuig a chéile
To claim assessment as a single person, you will have to contact your tax office
Chun éileamh a dhéanamh ar mheasúnú mar dhuine singil, ní mór duit iarratas scríofa a dhéanamh go dtí d'oifig chánach
Either spouse/civil partner can make the claim and the option remains until the person who claims it changes his or her mind
Is féidir leis an mbeirt pháirtithe an t-éileamh a dhéanamh, agus leanann an rogha go dtí go n-athraíonn an duine a dhéanann an t-éileamh a (h)intinn
If you wish to claim assessment as a single person, you must apply within the tax year (preferably at the start of the year)
Má bhíonn tú ag iarraidh éileamh a dhéanamh ar mheasúnú mar dhuine singil, beidh ort iarratas a dhéanamh taobh istigh den bhliain chánach (de rogha ag tús na bliana, i mí Eanáir)
Choosing to be assessed as a single person when you are married or in a civil partnership is unfavourable in some circumstances
Tá an rogha ar mheasúnú mar dhuine singil nuair atá tú pósta míbhuntáisteach i gcásanna áirithe
This is mainly because you cannot transfer any unused tax credits or standard rate cut-off point
Tá sé amhlaidh go príomha mar nach féidir creidmheasanna cánach nó scoithphointe an ráta chaighdeánaigh a aistriú
You cannot claim Home Carer's Tax Credit if your spouse/civil partner is caring for a dependent person and would otherwise qualify for the relief
Má tá duine cleithiúnach faoi do chúram, ní féidir leat éileamh a dhéanamh ar Chreidmheas Cánach do Chúramóir Baile
Under the separate assessment option, the tax affairs of spouses/civil partners are independent of each other
Le measúnú ar leithligh, bíonn gnóthaí cánach céilí neamhspleách ar a chéile
The difference between separate assessment and the previous option (assessment as a single person) is that under this option, some tax credits are divided equally between you
Is í an difríocht idir measúnú ar leithligh agus an rogha roimhe (measúnú mar dhuine singil) ná, faoin rogha seo, go roinntear cuid de na creidmheasanna cánach go cothrom eadraibh
These tax credits are:
Is iad na creidmeasanna cánach seo ná:
• Blind Person's Tax Credit
• Creidmheas Cánach do Dhuine Dall,
• Incapacitated Child Tax Credit
• Creidmheas Cánach do Leanaí Éagumasacha
The balance of the tax credits is given to each of you in proportion to the cost borne by you
Tugtar fuílleach na gcreidmheasanna cánach daoibh araon i gcomhréir leis an gcostas atá íoctha agat
The PAYE tax credit and expenses (if any), are allocated to the appropriate spouse/civil partner
Tugtar an creidmheas cánach ÍMAT agus costais, más ann dóibh, don chéile cuí
Any tax credits other than the PAYE tax credit and employment expenses that are unused by one partner can be claimed by the other spouse/civil partner
Is féidir le páirtí amháin éileamh a dhéanamh ar chreidmheasanna cánach ar bith seachas an creidmheas cánach ÍMAT agus costais fhostaíochta nár úsáid an céile eile
The tax credits are not usually adjusted until after the end of the tax year
De ghnáth ní athraítear na creidmheasanna cánach go dtí tar éis deireadh na bliana cánach

Any tax credits that are unused (other than the PAYE tax credit and employment expenses) and the standard rate cut-off point up to €42,800 in 2017 can be transferred to the other spouse/civil partner but only at the end of the tax year

Is féidir creidmheasanna cánach nár úsáideadh agus scoithphointe an ráta chaighdeánaigh suas go €41,800 do 2014 - ach amháin an creidmheas cánach ÍMAT agus costais fhostaíochta - a aistriú go dtí an céile eile, ach ag deireadh na bliana cánach amháin
The increase in the standard rate tax band of up to €24,800 in 2017 is not transferable between partners
Níl an méadú ar bhanda an ráta chánach chaighdeánaigh suas go €23,800 do 2014 inaistrithe idir chéilí
If you think you have unused tax credits or standard rate cut-off point, contact your tax office for a review after the end of the tax year

Má cheapann tú go bhfuil creidmheasanna cánach nó scoithphointe an ráta chaighdeánaigh nach bhfuil úsáidte agat, téigh i dteagmháil le d'oifig chánach le haghaidh athbreithnithe tar éis deireadh na bliana cánach
Overall, the amount of the tax that is payable under this option (separate assessment) is the same that is payable under the joint assessment option discussed below
San iomlán tá an méid cánach atá iníoctha faoin rogha seo (measúnú ar leithligh) mar a chéile leis an méid atá iníoctha faoi chóimheasúnú a phléitear thíos
The claim for separate assessment must be between 1 October of the preceding year and the 31 March in the year of the claim
Ní foláir an t-éileamh a dhéanamh sa tréimhse idir 1 Deireadh Fómhair agus 31 Márta. Ní féidir é a iardhátú agus leanann an rogha seo go dtí go dtarraingíonn duine agaibh siar í
Either spouse or civil partner can request this form of assessment
Is féidir le ceachtar agaibh iarratas a dhéanamh ar mheasúnú den chineál seo
To withdraw the option, you must contact your tax office
Chun an rogha a tharraingt siar, caithfear iarratas scríofa a chur chuig d'oifig chánach
Each spouse or civil partner can complete a separate return of his or her own income
Is féidir le gach páirtí tuairisceán ar leith a líonadh dá (h)ioncam féin
The joint assessment (or "aggregation") option is usually the most favourable basis of assessment for a married couple or civil partners
De ghnáth is é cóimheasúnú (nó comhiomlánú) an cineál measúnaithe is mó a théann chun tairbhe do lanúin phósta
This option is automatically given by the tax office when you advise them of your marriage or civil partnership but this does not prevent you from choosing any of the options examined earlier

Cuireann an oifig chánach an rogha seo i bhfeidhm go huathoibritheach nuair a chuireann tú iad ar an eolas faoi do phósadh, ach ní chuireann sé sin cosc ort aon cheann de na roghanna a scrúdaíodh cheana a roghnú
Under this option, the tax credits and standard rate cut-off point can be allocated between spouses to suit their own circumstances
Faoin rogha seo, is féidir le céilí creidmheasanna cánach agus scoithphointe an ráta chaighdeánaigh a dháileadh eatarthu mar a fheileann dá gcás féin
If only one spouse/civil partner has taxable income, all tax credits and the standard rate cut-off point will be given to the spouse/civil partner with the income
Muna bhfuil ioncam ach ag páirtí amháin, tabharfar na creidmheasanna cánach ar fad agus scoithphointe an ráta chaighdeánaigh don pháirtí leis an ioncam
If both of you have taxable income, you can decide which of you is to be the assessable spouse/nominated civil partner
Má tá ioncam incháinithe ag an mbeirt agaibh, tá an rogha agaibh cinneadh a dhéanamh cé hé an páirtí inmheasta
You then ask the tax office to allocate the tax credits and standard rate cut-off point between you in whatever way you wish
Ansin iarrann tú ar an oifig chánach na creidmheasanna cánach agus scoithphointe an ráta chaighdeánaigh a dháileadh oraibh mar is mian libh
(The PAYE tax credit, employment expenses and the increase in standard rate cut-off point of €24,800 in 2017 are not transferable)
(Níl an creidmheas cánach ÍMAT, costais fhostaíochta agus scoithphointe bunúsach an ráta chaighdeánaigh de €23,800 i 2014 inaistrithe)

If your tax office does not get a request from you to allocate your tax credits in any particular way; the tax office will normally give all the tax credits (other than the other partner's PAYE and expense tax credits) to the spouse/civil partner being assessed

Muna bhfaigheann an oifig chánach iarratas uaibh ar bhur gcreidmheasanna cánach a dháileadh ar bhealach ar leith, de ghnáth tabharfaidh an oifig chánach na creidmheasanna cánach go léir (seachas creidmheasanna cánach ÍMAT an pháirtí eile agus creidmeasanna cánach costais) don chéile atá á mheasúnú
The spouse/civil partner being assessed must complete the return of income for the couple and is chargeable to tax on the joint income of the couple
Caithfidh an céile atá á m(h)easúnú an tuairisceán ioncaim don lanúin a líonadh agus gearrfar cáin air/uirthi ar chomhioncam na lánúine
If one spouse/civil partner is self-employed, joint assessment can still apply
Má tá céile amháin féinfhostaithe, fós féin is féidir cóimheasúnú a chur i bhfeidhm
The flexibility this option brings can be very convenient - especially if one of you pays tax under the PAYE system and the other pays tax under the self-assessment system
Is féidir leis an tsolúbthacht a bhaineann leis an rogha seo a bheith an-áisiúil, go háirithe má íocann duine agaibh cáin faoin gcóras ÍMAT agus an duine eile faoin gcóras féinmheasúnaithe
Under joint assessment, you let your circumstances determine if most of the tax should be paid under PAYE or in a lump sum on assessment
Faoin gcóras cóimheasúnaithe ligtear leat breathnú ar do chúinsí chun an cinneadh a dhéanamh an íocfar an chuid is mó den cháin faoin gcóras ÍMAT nó mar chnapshuim ar mheasúnú
This is determined by the way in which the tax credits are allocated
Braitheann sé seo ar an gcaoi ina ndáiltear na creidmheasanna cánach
If you choose to pay most of your tax under PAYE, the tax credits (apart from the PAYE tax credit and employment expenses), should be offset against the self-assessment income

Má roghnaíonn tú go n-íocfar an chuid is mó den cháin faoin gcóras ÍMAT, ba cheart na creidmheasanna cánach a fhritháireamh i gcoinne an ioncaim fhéinmheasúnaithe, (seachas creidmheas cánach ÍMAT agus costais fhostaíochta)
The choice about who becomes the assessable spouse or nominated civil partner is made by both of you
Ní chaithfidh sibh aon rud a dhéanamh ach a chur in iúl cé a bheidh mar chéile inmheasta
All you need to do is to inform Revenue which of you is to be the assessable spouse or nominated civil partner
Tá an fhoirm a chaithfidh sibh a líonadh ar fáil sa bhileog ag deireadh na cáipéise seo agus is féidir í a íoschóipeáil

If you have not made your nomination, the spouse or civil partner with the higher income in the latest year for which details of both spouses' incomes are known becomes the assessable spouse or nominated civil partner

Go hidéalach, ba cheart daoibh an céile inmheasta a ainmniú roimh dheireadh na bliana cánach (is é sin 1 Eanáir) chun a bheith cinnte go ndáiltear na creidmheasanna cánach cearta agus scoithphointe an ráta chaighdeánaigh ar na céilí araon ó thús na bliana cánach

This person continues to be the assessable spouse/nominated civil partner until both of you jointly elect that the other spouse/civil partner is to be the assessable spouse/nominated civil partner or until either of you opts for either separate assessment or assessment as a single person

Muna bhfuil an t-ainmniú déanta agat, is é an céile inmheasta ná an céile inmheasta leis an ioncam is airde sa bhliain dheireanach a bhfuil sonraí ioncam an dá chéile ar fáil di. Fanann an duine seo mar chéile inmheasta go dtí go gcomhchinneann an bheirt agaibh go mbeidh an céile eile mar chéile inmheasta, nó go dtí go roghnaíonn ceachtar agaibh measúnú ar leithligh nó measúnú mar dhuine singil
Repayments that arise from an end of year review will in general be apportioned and repaid on the basis of the tax paid by each spouse/civil partner
De ghnáth roinnfear agus aisíocfar aisíocaíochtaí a éiríonn as athbhreithniú cinn bhliana ar bhonn na cánach a d'íoc gach céile
If both of you are in employment, then a Certificate of Tax Credits is issued to each of you
Má tá an bheirt agaibh fostaithe eisítear Teastas Creidmheasanna Cánach don bheirt agaibh

All of the tax credits and reliefs due to a married couple or civil partners where joint assessment applies are shown on the assessable spouse/nominated civil partner's notice - the amount "allocated to other employments" is also shown

Taispeántar na creidmheasanna cánach agus na faoisimh go léir dlite do lánúin phósta nuair atá cóimheasúnú i bhfeidhm ar fhógra an chéile inmheasta - taispeántar an tsuim "dáilte d'fhostaíochtaí eile" chomh maith

This amount ("allocated to other employments") represents the tax credits that are allocated to the other spouse/civil partner and may also include tax credits that are allocated to a subsidiary employment or pension of either spouse/civil partner

Léiríonn an tsuim seo ("dáilte d’fhostaíochtaí eile") na creidmheasanna cánach a dháiltear don chéile eile agus d'fhéadfadh creidmheasanna cánach dáilte d'fhofhostaíocht nó pinsean ceachtar céile a bheith san áireamh
The standard rate cut-off point for married couples/civil partners is €42,800 in 2017
Is é scoithphointe an ráta chaighdeánaigh do lánúineacha pósta don bhliain 2014 ná €41,800 ag 20%, fuílleach ag 41%, faoi réir ag méadú suas go uasmhéid €23,800 do lánúineacha dé-ioncaim
This amount is taxed at 20% and the balance is taxed at 40%
Tá teorainn ar an méadú don cheann is lú,
• The amount of the income of the spouse/civil partner with the smaller income
• Ioncam an chéile leis an ioncam is lú
The increase in the standard rate cut-off point interacts with the Home Carer's Tax Credit
Imoibríonn an méadú i scoithphointe an ráta chaighdeánaigh leis an gCreidmheas Cánach do Chúramóir Baile
If the increased standard rate cut-off point is more beneficial than the Home Carer's Tax Credit, you can claim the increase instead

Má tá an méadú i scoithphointe an ráta chaighdeánaigh níos tairbhí duit, áfach, is féidir leat an méadú i scoithphointe an ráta chaighdeánaigh a éileamh in áit an Chreidmheasa Cánach do Chúramóir Baile
As a matter of course, the tax office will grant you whichever is more beneficial to you
Sa ghnáthchúrsa, tabharfaidh an oifig chánach duit cibé ceann is tairbhí duit
More information is available about the Home Carer's Tax Credit (pdf)
Is féidir tuilleadh faoi Chreidmheas Cánach do Chúramóir Baile (pdf) a léamh anseo
Joint assessment: to nominate or change the assessable spouse for 2017, you must contact Revenue before 31 March 2017 - see 'Where to apply' below
Cóimheasúnú: Chun an céile inmheasta a ainmniú nó a athrú caithfidh tú dul i dteagmháil leis na Coimisinéirí Ioncaim roimh 31 Márta 2014 – féach ‘Cá háit a ndéanfaidh mé iarratas’ thíos
You can also fill in an Assessable Spouse Election Form (pdf) and send it to Revenue before 31 March 2017
Is féidir leat an Fhoirm Roghnú Chéile Inmheasta (pdf) a chomhlánú freisin agus í do na Coimisinéirí Ioncaim a sheoladh roimh 31 Márta 2014
Separate assessment: to be assessed separately from your spouse in 2017, you must contact Revenue between 1 October 2016 and 31 March 2017 - see 'Where to apply' below

Measúnú ar leithligh: Chun iarratas a dhéanamh ar mheasúnú ar leithligh, caithfidh tú dul i dteagmháil leis na Coimisinéirí Ioncaim sa tréimhse idir 1 Deireadh Fómhair 2013 agus 31 Márta 2014 – féach ‘Cá háit a ndéanfaidh mé iarratas’ thíos
If you haven't applied for a joint or separate assessment by the dates set by Revenue, you will have to wait until the following year to apply
Tá tuilleadh eolais faoi ghearradh cánach ar dhaoine pósta, le samplaí a léiríonn an chaoi a ngearrfar cáin ar ioncam, ar fáil sa bhileog na gCoimisinéirí Ioncaim IT2 Gearradh Cánach ar Dhaoine Pósta

Further information about the taxation of married people and civil partners, with examples showing how income is taxed, is available in the Revenue Commissioners' Leaflet IT2: Taxation of Married Persons and Civil Partners
Tá ceisteanna coitianta faoi ghearradh cánach tar éis pósadh tairgthe ag na Coimisinéirí Ioncaim
The Revenue Commissioners have produced some useful frequently asked questions about taxation following marriage
Cá háit a ndéanfaidh mé iarratas
Lo-call telephone numbers for Revenue regional offices are available on Revenue's website. You can also get contact details for offices in your region
Is féidir leat sonraí teagmhála níos mionsonraithe na gCoimisinéirí Ioncaim do do réigiún féin a fháil anseo
